result.execSummary:
The defendant Nia L Rivera was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Straight time.  Sentence Credit for 62 days granted.
Court deems TIME SERVED.

Court costs waived.
DNA Surcharge waived.
DNA Sample waived.

Defendant Nia L Rivera in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph Smith.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.

Court orders the following:
- 60 days jail.  Credit for 62 days.  COURT DEEMS TIME SERVED.
- Court costs waived.
- DNA Surcharge waived
- DNA Sample waived
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
